titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the photograph album 'Egypt and Sudan Post Card Album' compiled by Edith and William P. Lincoln - Hisham Khatib Collection AD.MC.030_ref165
titlestmt.author: Jasmine Soliman and Jonathan Burr for Akkasah: Photography Archive at NYUAD

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-05-25 18:16:09 +0400.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.unittitle: 'Egypt and Sudan Post Card Album' compiled by Edith and William P. Lincoln - Hisham Khatib Collection
did.abstract: An album of postcards of Egypt, from a journey in February 1929, compiled by William P. Lincoln and Edith Lincoln. The album also includes around ten gelatin silver prints, some which feature the crew of the Nile cruise taken, and ephemera such as newspaper clippings, passes to antiquities sites and a bill from the Shepheard's Hotel. The album belongs to the Hisham Khatb Collection.

scopecontent.head: Content Description
scopecontent.p: Digital surrogates of an album of postcards of Egypt, from a journey in February 1929, compiled by William P. Lincoln and Edith Lincoln. The album also includes around ten gelatin silver prints, some which feature the crew of the Nile cruise taken, and ephemera such as newspaper clippings, passes to antiquities sites and a bill from the Shepheard's Hotel.

This album is part of the Hisham Khatib Collection of igital surrogates of 2,930 photographs and postcards (both individual prints and contained within albums) focused on the Near East, including the Holy Land, Palestine, Jordan, Turkey, Syria and Egypt as well as a very small number from Europe.

did.unittitle: 'Egypt and Sudan Post Card Album' compiled by Edith and William P. Lincoln - Hisham Khatib Collection

The front cover of the 'Egypt and Sudan Post Card Album' compiled by Edith and William P. Lincoln - Hisham Khatib Collection, featuring an image of the entrance to the tomb of Tutankhamun (KV62) in Thebes and the arms of the cities of London and Paris.
The inside front cover of the 'Egypt and Sudan Post Card Album' compiled by Edith and William P. Lincoln - Hisham Khatib Collection.
A blank page in 'Egypt and Sudan Post Card Album' compiled by Edith and William P. Lincoln - Hisham Khatib Collection.
Top: [Form No. 439] A disembarkation card granted in Port Said. Bottom: A blank arrival card issued by the Egyptian government.
Top: a postcard of women leading a herd of goats. Bottom: A postcard of women gathering water and washing clothes in a village surrounded by palm trees.
Three postcards. Top: The Qasr el Nil Bridge in Cairo. Middle: Men and women at an oasis. Bottom: a landscape of an oasis.
Top: A newspaper clipping from The Egyptian Mail detailing the arrivals at Shepheard's Hotel. Bottom: A postcard of Shepheard's Hotel, Cairo.
Two postcards. Top: The interior of Shepheard's Hotel showing The Moorish Lounge. Bottom: The garden at Shepheard's Hotel.
Top: William. P. Lincoln's bill from the Shepheard's Hotel. Bottom: The cover of an illustrated guide map of the Nile issued by the Tourist Development Association of Egypt.
The inside of the illustrated guide map of the Nile issued by the Tourist Development Association of Egypt (linked Ref165_000009b).
Two views of the Great Pyramids of Giza, the top includes the Great Sphinx of Giza.
A view of square columns in The Valley Temple of Pharaoh Khafre.

Top: a pamphlet from the Egyptian Museum [Museum of Cairo] featuring a wooden statuette of Ka-Aper, known as Sheikh el-Beled. Bottom: Two postcards. Left: A bronze statue of Pepi I. Right: A statue of Ti, Old Kingdom. From The Mastaba of Ti at Saqqara. Dynasty 5, during the reign of Nuiserre 2416-2392 BC.

Three postcards from the Egyptian Museum [Museum of Cairo]. Top: Wooden models of soldiers of Mesehti, Egyptian Pikemen, Middle Kingdom, 11th Dynasty. Bottom Left: A statue of Senusret. Bottom Right: A statue of Amenhotep, son of Hapu.

Three postcards from the Egyptian Museum [Museum of Cairo]. Top: A statue of the dwarf Khnumhotep. Bottom Left: A statue of Khaiya, the keeper of the funerary Temple of Ramses II. Bottom Right: A statue of an Egyptian family.

Three postcards from the Egyptian Museum [Museum of Cairo]. Top: Wooden busts. Bottom Left: A statue of the priest Ranefer. Bottom Right: A snake sculpture on the lid of a box from a temple of Aesculapius.
Two antiquities site passes labeled "Service Des Antiquites De L'Egypte" (Egypt Antiquities Service).
Two antiquities site passes labeled "Service Des Antiquites De L'Egypte" (Egypt Antiquities Service).
The inside of the entry tickets to the Egyptian monuments labeled "Service Des Antiquites De L'Egypte" (Egypt Antiquities Service), signed by William and Edith Lincoln.
The inside of the antiquities site passes labeled "Service Des Antiquites De L'Egypte" (Egypt Antiquities Service).
A map of the Nile River between Luxor, Aswan and Halfa.
A map of the upper Nile River between the Mediterranean and Qena, showing Alexandria and Port Said.
Thomas Cook and Son, Nile Navigation Dept. Steamer booklet and passenger's bill.
A handdrawn sketch map of the Nile River Valley, including various monuments.
A view of a steamer on the Nile River named 's.s. Damietta.'
A diagram/plan of the Nile steamer, Rosetta's, three decks (promenade, upper, and main).
The title page for the 'Schedule of Mileage from Cairo to Aswan.'
The first page for the 'Schedule of Mileage from Cairo to Aswan.'
The last page for the 'Schedule of Mileage from Cairo to Aswan.'

Please note: This material has been digitized in its entirety and contains racist and culturally insensitive remarks. A page entitled Baksheesh that urges Nile steamer passengers to avoid donating money to villagers along the Nile.
William Lincoln's passenger bill from the Nile steamer 'Damietta', issued by Thos. Cook & Son (Egypt) Ltd. Nile Navigation Department.
A clipping of the Pyramid of Djoser in Saqqara, with the text "Egypt Memphis and Sakkara."

Top: (No. 1132) Sakkara - The Step Pyramid (a postcard of two men in front of the Pyramid of Djoser). Bottom: (No. 1133) The Step Pyramid seen from the Sycomore (the Pyramid of Djoser seen at a distance).

Top: (No. 1134) Sakkara - The Pyramids of Dashur (a postcard of a canal and fields with the Bent Pyramid (Pyramid of Sneferu) in the background). Bottom Left: (No. 1135) Sakkara -Tomb of Ptahotep - Mural Decoration (a relief in the Tomb of Ptahhotep). Bottom Right: (No. 1136) Sakkara - Tomb of Ti Mural - Mural Painting (a mural painting in the Tomb of Ti).

Top: Memphis - The Colossal Statue of Ramesses II (a postcard of the Colossal Statue of Ramesses II in Memphis). Bottom: (No. 1130) Memphis - The Colossal Statue of Ramesses II (Detail) (a boy crouching beside the Colossal Statue of Ramesses II).

Top: Memphis - The Colossal Statue of Ramesses II (a postcard of the Colossal Statue of Ramesses II in Memphis). Bottom: Memphis - Head of the Statue of Ramesses II (a postcard of a boy with the head of Statue of Ramesses II).
Two postcards labeled 'Memphis - The alabaster Sphinx' (the Sphinx of Memphis).
A close view of the Sphinx of Memphis.
Top: A clipping with the text 'Upper-Egypt Abidos-Denderah' with a view of the Temple of Dendera. Bottom: A clipping with the text 'birth house of Horus at the Temple of Dendera.'
Cook's Nile Services booklet and promotional material
A clipping of a promotional image of the promenade deck of a Nile steamer.
A printed cartoon on a Cook's Nile Services booklet by Tony Binder of silhouettes of people by the banks of the Nile. A man riding a donkey, two women carrying jars on their heads and a child.
The passenger list for the Nile steamer, s.s. 'Damietta' in a Cook's Nile Services booklet.
An advertisement for the tourist steamer 'Thebes.'
Top: Three portraits of men on the steamer, s.s. 'Damietta'. Bottom: a group portrait of the s.s. 'Damietta's' crew.
A blank page in 'Egypt and Sudan Post Card Album' compiled by Edith and William P. Lincoln - Hisham Khatib Collection.

Three postcards. Top: (No. 1560) Abydos: The famous Liste of the Kings (the Abydos King List). Bottom Left: (No. 1556) Abydos: The Temple of Sethos (a postcard of a man in the Temple of Sethos). Bottom Right: (No. 1559) Pillars of the Temple (a postcard of pillars in the Temple of Sethos).

Three postcards. Top: Abydos: Sethos offering to the Sacred Boats (a relief in the Temple of Sethos depicting Sethos' offering of the sacred boats). Bottom Left: (No.1566) Denderah: The Temple of the Goddess Hathor. Bottom Right: Abydos: Part of the Temple of Sethos I (a man sitting at the base of a column in the Temple of of Sethos I).

Three postcards. Top: (No. 1558) Abydos: Arabet el Madfune (A view of the town, El Araba El Madfuna). Bottom Left: (No. 1565) Denderah: Ptolomey offering to Hathor and Horus. Bottom Right: (No. 1567) Denderah: The Temple of the Goddess Hathor (a view of the Temple of Hathor within the Dendera Temple Complex).
Top: (No. 1563) Denderah: The Great Vestibule of the Temple of Hathor. Bottom: (No. 1564) Denderah Ptolomey offering to Isis and Horus.
Top: (No. 1562) Denderah: The Temple of Hathor. Bottom: a view of an ancient Egyptian relief.
Top: Bas-reliefs of Cleopatra and Caesarion on a section of the back wall of the Temple of Hathor in the Temple of Dendera complex. Middle: The Temple of Dendera. Bottom: A bridge construction site.

Top: A clipping entitled 'Upper-Egypt Luxor,' with a view of the Luxor Temple. Bottom Left: A clipping with the text "Cario: Bazaar in the Mousky." Bottom Right: A clipping with the text "Luxor: Statues of Ramesses II" (two statues of Ramesses II in the Temple of Luxor).
Two views of the Luxor Temple.
Two views of the statues of Ramesses II, and a woman sitting between two columns in the Luxor Temple.
Two postcards of the pillars of Amenhotep III in the Luxor Temple. Top: (No.203) Luxor Papyrus Pillar of Amenhotep III. Bottom: (No. 1501) Luxor Temple: Papyrus Pillars of Amenhotep III.
Two postcards of the pillars of Amenhotep III in the Luxor Temple. Top: Luxor: The Papyrus Columns of Amenhotep III. Bottom: (No. 1508) Luxor-Temple: Papyrus Columns of Amen Hotep III.
A postcard with the text "Luxor Temple: The Colonnade."
Top: A woman next to the statues in the Luxor Temple. Bottom: Two postcards. Left: (No.1505) Luxor Temple: Wife of Ramesses II. Right: (No.1506) Luxor Temple: Statue of Ramesses II.
Two postcards. Top: Luxor Temple: The Forecourt and Statues of Rameses II. Bottom: (No.1503) Luxor Temple: Pylon and Obelisk.
Two postcards. Top: Luxor. Pylon Statues and Obelisk of Ramesses II. Bottom: (No.1504) Luxor - Mosque of Sheikh Abu el Haggag (a postcard of the Abou al-Haggag Mosque).
Top: (No.1511) Luxor: Nilesteamers and Winter Palace Hotel. Bottom: Two views of different reliefs both representing Min, the god of fertility.
Top: (No. 1510) Luxor: Crossing the Nile (a postcard of a sailboat crossing the Nile River). Bottom Left: a hieroglyphic relief. Bottom Right: columns in the Luxor Temple.
Top: (No.1529) Thebes: Der-El-Bahari, Temple of Queen Hatshepsut. Bottom: A view of the Temple of Hatshepsut.
Two views of the Temple of Hatshepsut.
Top: A clipping with the text 'Upper-Egypt Thebes.' Bottom Left: Karnak: The Hypostyle Hall. Bottom Right: A man with two children in front of the Colossi of Memnon.
No. 1524 Thebes: The Colossi of Memnon (a postcard of two men on the road to the Colossi of Memnon).
(No.1532) Thebes: Part of the Ramesseum and the greatest Statue of Ramesses II.
Three postcards. Top: (No. 1525) Thebes: the Ramesseum. Bottom Left: (No. 1526)Thebes: the Ramesseum - Statue of Ramesses. Bottom Right: (No. 1527) Thebes: the Ramesseum reliefs.
Two men near a hillside with exposed rock-cut tombs at the Tomb of the Nobles, Luxor.

Three postcards. Top: (No. 1534) Thebes: Medinet Habu - statue of the goddess. Middle: (No. 1533) Thebes: Medinet Habu - The Temple of Rameses III. Bottom: (No. 1535) Thebes: Medinet Habu - The Pavillion of the Temple of Rameses III.
A blank page in the 'Egypt and Sudan Post Card Album' compiled by Edith and William P. Lincoln - Hisham Khatib Collection.
Top: A clipping with the text 'Upper-Egypt Karnak.' Bottom: (No.1514) Karnak: Ptolomey - Gateway and the Temple of Khonsu.
A blank page in the 'Egypt and Sudan Post Card Album' compiled by Edith and William P. Lincoln - Hisham Khatib Collection.
Top: Karnak: The Amun Temple. Bottom: Two views of the Statue of Amun Ra at Karnak Temple, Luxor, Egypt.
Two postcards. Top: (No.1527) Karnak: The Great Temple of Amun Ra and the Sacred Lake. Bottom: (No.1512) Karnak: The Great Temple of Amun Ra.
Top: (No.1516) Karnak: The Temple of Amun Ra. Bottom: Karnak: Central view of the Great Temple of Amun Ra.
Top: (No.1520) Karnak: The Temple of Rameses III. Bottom: a view of two people near the statues in the Temple of Rameses III.
Top: Reliefs on a temple's facade. Bottom: A woman standing in a temple.
Three postcards. Top: (No.1523) Karnak: the Temple of Opet. Bottom Left: (No. 1518) Karnak: The Hypostyle Hall. Bottom Right: (No.1519) Karnak: Pillars in the Great Hypostyle Hall.
Top: (No.1513) Karnak: Memorials of Thotmes III. Bottom: An Egyptian relief depicting animals and plants from the botanical garden wall at the Temple of Karnak.
(No.1517,1515) Two postcards. Karnak: Avenue of the Sphinxes.
Three views of the Avenue of the Sphinxes in Karnak.
Three group portraits of people in front of tents.
Top and Middle: Two views of sailboats with passengers. Bottom: A group of men in the desert.
Two views of the Valley of the Kings.
Top: A view of King Tutankhamen's Tomb. Bottom: A road in the Valley of the Kings.
A view of the first coffin and sarcophagus of King Tutankhamen.
A postcard showing the mural paintings in Tomb 9 of Ramesses V and VI.
A postcard of the mural paintings in the side chamber of the Tomb of Seti I in the Valley of the Kings.
A postcard of a mural painting from the Tomb of Rameses I.
A view of a bridge and people standing on the bank of a river.
Two group portraits of a crowd.
Top: A clipping with the text 'Upper-Egypt Edfou-Komombo.' Bottom Left: (No.1570) Edfou: Reliefs of the Temple of Horus. Bottom Right: (No.1569) Edfou: the Temple of Horus.
Three postcards. Top: (No. 1572) Edfou: Pillar-vestibule of the Temple of Horus. Bottom Left: (No.1568) Edfou: the Temple of Horus. Bottom Right: (No.1571) Edfou: Part of the Temple of Horus.
Two views of the columns and reliefs at the Temple of Horus, Edfu.
Three postcards. Top: (No. 1572) Edfou: Pillar-vestibule of the Temple of Horus. Bottom Left: (No.1568) Edfou: the Temple of Horus. Bottom Right: (No.1571) Edfou: Part of the Temple of Horus.
A newspaper clipping with the text 'Portion of the outer wall at the Temple of Komombo. Showing a table of surgical instruments representing the clinic of Imhotep, god of medicine.'
Top: (No. 1573) Edfou: The Temple of Horus. Bottom: A woman sitting at the Temple of Horus.
Top: (No. 1575) Kom-Ombo: The Temple of Ombo. Bottom: Kom-Ombo: General View.
A newspaper clipping showing a relief in the Temple of Kom Ombo with the text, "The gods Thoth and Horus pouring the water of life over the king. A carving on the walls of the Temple of Komombo."

Top: A view of the Temple of Kom Ombo from afar. Bottom Left: (No.1578) Komombo: Ptolomey between the two Divinities of Upper and Lower Egypt. Bottom Right: (No. 1577) Komombo: God Horus writing the Life of Philometer.
Top: (No. 1576) Kom-Ombo: The Temple of Ombos seen from the Nile. Bottom: (No. 1574) Kom-Ombo: the Temple of Ombos.
Top: A cutout depicting the Nile steamers 'Delta' and 'Thebes.' Bottom: The front cover of the passenger list for Cook's Nile Services steamer 's.s. Thebes' (linked ref 89_02).
Top: A cutout depicting the Nile steamers 'Delta' and 'Thebes.' Bottom: The passenger list for Cook's Nile Services steamer 's.s. Thebes' (linked ref 89_01).
From the top left clockwise: A man holding a donkey, the Temple of Kom Ombo from afar, a man leaning on columns while holding a sword, and a postcard (No. 1579) Kom-Ombo: Crowning of Philometer.
From the top left clockwise: A man holding a donkey, the Temple of Kom Ombo from afar, a man leaning on columns while holding a sword, and a postcard (No. 1579) Kom-Ombo: Crowning of Philometer.
Top: A clipping with the text 'Upper-Egypt Assouan.' Bottom: (No. 1536) Aswan seen from Elephantine Island.

Three postcards. Top: (No. 1542) Aswan: the first cataract (the first cataract of the Nile River). Bottom Left: (No. 1539) Aswan: entrance to the bazaars. Bottom Right: (No. 1543) Aswan: Native House (a group of women and children outside their house in Aswan).
Two postcards: Top: (No. 1544) Aswan: Cataract Hotel. Bottom: (No. 1540) Aswan: General View.
Top: (No.1130) Memphis - The Colossal Statue of Ramesses II (Detail). Bottom: Two boys in rowboats in a river.

Top: A view of a village. Bottom Left: (No. 1547) Aswan: Type of the Bishsarin (a woman of the Bishari tribe in her regional dress). Bottom Right: (No. 1548) Aswan: type of the Bishari race (a portrait of a member of the Bishari tribe).
Top: A postcard of a dam. Middle: Three photographs, two show a dam and the other shows a group portrait of men in regional dress. Bottom: (No.1555) Aswan: Philae before the Inundation.
Top: (No. 1552) Aswan Niledam. Bottom: (No.1541) Aswan Niledam.
Two postcards. Top: Aswan: Pylon of the Temple of Isis. Bottom: Aswan: Pylon and Kiosk of Philae (the Temple of Isis and Trajan's Kiosk).
Two postcards. Top: (No. 1554) Aswan - Philae before the inundation. Bottom: (No.1553) Aswan: The Temple of Isis before the inundation.
Two views of men on the pylons in the Temple of Isis.
Top: (No. 1549) Aswan: The submerged holy island of Philae. Bottom: A view of the submerged Temple of Isis.
Top: A man holding a snake in a palm forest. Bottom: A view of temples.
Top: A view of the submerged Temple of Isis. Bottom: A man handling a snake with other men behind him.
A blank page in the 'Egypt and Sudan Post Card Album' compiled by Edith and William P. Lincoln - Hisham Khatib Collection.
Two views of crowds in a village, with an oasis in the background.
A blank page in the 'Egypt and Sudan Post Card Album' compiled by Edith and William P. Lincoln - Hisham Khatib Collection.
Top: (No.1134) Sakkara - The Pyramids of Dashur. Bottom: A crowd near a building surrounded by palm trees.
A blank page in the 'Egypt and Sudan Post Card Album' compiled by Edith and William P. Lincoln - Hisham Khatib Collection.
A blank page in the 'Egypt and Sudan Post Card Album' compiled by Edith and William P. Lincoln - Hisham Khatib Collection.
A blank page in the 'Egypt and Sudan Post Card Album' compiled by Edith and William P. Lincoln - Hisham Khatib Collection.
The back cover of the 'Egypt and Sudan Post Card Album' compiled by Edith and William P. Lincoln - Hisham Khatib Collection.
